item.title: Friday, January 20, 2017
item.description:
Friday, January 20, 2017

Getting Online

item.title: Lesson Plan
item.description:
By the end of this lesson, students should be able to answer the following questions:

  1. What is a web server?
  2. What happens when an end user visits a web address using a browser?
  3. What is a URL?
  4. How does the file path affect the URL?
  5. Why do we use index.html as a file name?
  6. How do I get my stuff on the internet?

Students should also understand how to deploy a website using Github (this may be a review).

Resources

Mozilla Developer Network Common Questions

  • What is a URL?

  • Creating a Project Site using Github

item.title: Homework
item.description:
Due Monday, Jan 24

  1. (Originally assigned on Jan 18) CodeCademy “About Me” lesson

Newly Assigned - both are due Monday, Jan 24

  1. Sign up for a domain name at NameCheap.
  2. Do the following from the Design for Hackers Curriculum, Lesson 1
    • Read the first two parts of Startups, this is how design works. You can stop at the part that starts talking about data.
    • Look through Beautiful Web Type. What do you think about this? What is effective?
